channel.title: ScanX – Corporate Actions

item.title: Hubtown Limited Receives Trading Approval for 21.32 Lakh Equity Shares
item.description: Top News Hubtown Limited Receives Trading Approval for 21.32 Lakh Equity Shares 4 hours ago Hubtown Limited has secured trading approval from both NSE and BSE for 21,31,936 equity shares issued to promoters on preferential basis following warrant conversion. The shares, priced at ₹220 each (₹10 face value plus ₹210 premium), began trading on December 11, 2025, and are subject to a lock-in period until July 31, 2027.

item.title: Pharmaids Pharmaceuticals Announces Resignation of Vice President-Operations Dr. Sidde Gowda
item.description: Pharmaids Pharmaceuticals Announces Resignation of Vice President-Operations Dr. Sidde Gowda 4 hours ago Pharmaids Pharmaceuticals Limited announced the resignation of Dr. Sidde Gowda from his position as Vice President-Operations, effective December 10, 2025. The resignation was attributed to personal reasons and commitments, with no other material reasons cited. The company has completed all necessary regulatory filings under SEBI regulations.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens 11 hours ago Indian stock markets ended negative, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both down 0.32%. Market breadth favored decliners, with 2,382 stocks falling versus 2,166 advancing. IndiGo's operational crisis, Biocon's biologics consolidation, ICICI Bank's stake increase in its AMC, Infosys' Vietnam expansion, and Pine Labs' AI-powered bill pay feature were key highlights. The cautious sentiment was influenced by various corporate developments and global cues.

item.title: Sagar Diamonds Limited Reports Reduced Loss in H1 FY26 Amid Operational Halt
item.description: Sagar Diamonds Limited Reports Reduced Loss in H1 FY26 Amid Operational Halt 5 hours ago Sagar Diamonds Limited reported a net loss of ₹0.94 lakh for H1 FY26, significantly lower than the ₹182.91 lakh loss in H1 FY25. With operations suspended due to regulatory restrictions, the company generated ₹34.50 lakh from other income while maintaining strong cash reserves of ₹1,902.63 lakh. Total expenses declined 83% to ₹35.44 lakh, demonstrating effective cost management during the operational halt.
